content:
• Wednesday, November 30, 2011
  • PLM

    PolyMet Mining (NYSEMKT:PLM) trades higher in the post-session after the company announces a...

    PolyMet Mining (NYSEMKT:PLM) trades higher in the post-session after the company announces a $25M private placement, selling around 13.3M shares to Glencore AG at $1.50 per share. Shares +5.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:25 PM
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO) +3.7% AH following a Bloomberg report that an Alibaba-led group is preparing to bid...

    Yahoo (YHOO) +3.7% AH following a Bloomberg report that an Alibaba-led group is preparing to bid for the entire company. Yahoo’s board reportedly is meeting today to discuss earlier offers for a minority stake from bidders including Silver Lake and TPG Capital, but the Alibaba bid apparently would value Yahoo at more than the other offers.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:14 PM | 2 Comments
  • SMTC

    Analog chipmaker Semtech (NASDAQ:SMTC) drops 4.5% AH after posting FQ3 results. While revenue of...

    Analog chipmaker Semtech (NASDAQ:SMTC) drops 4.5% AH after posting FQ3 results. While revenue of $123.9M (+0.7% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.52 beat by $0.9M and $0.06, the company is guiding for FQ4 revenue of $102M-$108M and EPS of $0.27-$0.33, well below Street estimates of $117.7M and $0.43. Semtech's gross margin fell 120 bps Q/Q to 59.4%, and is expected to fall further in FQ4. (MXIM comments)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:22 PM
  • FTI

    FMC Technologies (FTI +5.1%) posted solid gains today after saying earlier that its Australian...

    FMC Technologies (FTI +5.1%) posted solid gains today after saying earlier that its Australian subsidiary signed a $325M agreement with Chevron Australia for the design, manufacture and supply of subsea production systems to support Chevron's Wheatstone Project.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM
  • SNPS

    In tandem with its FQ4 report, Synopsys (NASDAQ:SNPS) announces it's acquiring Magma Design...

    In tandem with its FQ4 report, Synopsys (NASDAQ:SNPS) announces it's acquiring Magma Design (NASDAQ:LAVA) for $7.35/share in cash - a 28% premium to Magma's closing price. The deal will cost Synopsys $507M net of cash and debt acquired, and will bolster its position as the world's largest provider of chip design software. Magma shares remain halted, while Synopsys is nearly unchanged.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM
  • JCI

    Johnson Controls (NYSE:JCI) finished the day up nearly 9% after a probe of lead emissions from...

    Johnson Controls (NYSE:JCI) finished the day up nearly 9% after a probe of lead emissions from its local plant in Shanghai cleared it of wrongdoing, enabling it to resume production. The temporary shutdown had caused a major disruption of its business as a key supplier in the world's largest auto market.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM
  • OMG

    Specialty chemical maker OM Group (NYSE:OMG) jumped +9.6% today on the back of a KeyBanc upgrade...

    Specialty chemical maker OM Group (NYSE:OMG) jumped +9.6% today on the back of a KeyBanc upgrade to Buy on valuation, citing a more positive near term risk-reward profile and stabilizing cobalt prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • ORN

    Shares of Orion Marine Group (NYSE:ORN) gain over +10.5% today after BB&T ups the shares to...

    Shares of Orion Marine Group (NYSE:ORN) gain over +10.5% today after BB&T ups the shares to Buy. The firm cites the company's strong balance sheet and a number of positive near-term catalysts, including passage of a new multi-year federal highway bill, incremental coastal-restoration projects related to the BP oil spill and passage of the Restore America's Maritime Promise Act.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • EXPR

    Apparel retailer Express (NYSE:EXPR) drops 3% AH after reporting FQ3 revenue of $486.8M (+8%...

    Apparel retailer Express (NYSE:EXPR) drops 3% AH after reporting FQ3 revenue of $486.8M (+8% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.37; the latter beat by $0.02, but the former missed by $1.1M. Same-store sales rose 5% Y/Y, compared with 6% in FQ2. The company expects FQ4 EPS of $0.66-$0.70 ($0.67 consensus), and same-store sales growth in the "mid single digits."

     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR +12.7%) took off in the final hour of trading, thanks to a Reuters report...

    Clearwire (CLWR +12.7%) took off in the final hour of trading, thanks to a Reuters report stating the struggling carrier will reach a funding agreement with Sprint (S +7.6%) by year's end, thereby allowing it to support Sprint's 4G LTE network plans. Clearwire is due to make a $237M debt payment tomorrow, and the company has reportedly been thinking of skipping it. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM
  • AGN

    The Lipitor war gets hotter for Watson Pharmaceuticals (WPI -4.3%) just hours after confirming...

    The Lipitor war gets hotter for Watson Pharmaceuticals (WPI -4.3%) just hours after confirming its generic launch, as reports surface that Indian drug maker Ranbaxy Laboratories is poised to receive its own approval from the FDA to launch its generic version of the drug.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM
  • EMR

    Emerson Electric (EMR +6.4%) says it has submitted a bid to win an automated systems contract at...

    Emerson Electric (EMR +6.4%) says it has submitted a bid to win an automated systems contract at Iraq's giant Zubair oil field. Emerson - a specialist in oil and gas, refining and power automation - submitted the bid to a consortium led by Italy's Eni (E +5.6%), Zubair's operator. The field holds ~8B barrels of oil reserves.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • BID

    Sotheby's (BID +16%) skyrockets after rival auction house Christie's wraps up a six-day Hong...

    Sotheby's (BID +16%) skyrockets after rival auction house Christie's wraps up a six-day Hong Kong auction marathon that raised more than HK$2.84B ($370M) amid participation that was considered "muted."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • X

    The jump in US Steel (X +14.7%) and AK Steel (AKS +10.05%) - on today's powerful rally in...

    The jump in US Steel (X +14.7%) and AK Steel (AKS +10.05%) - on today's powerful rally in commodities - comes despite Macquarie's initiating coverage on both with an underperform rating.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM | 1 Comment
  • MBI

    MBIA (MBI +17.4%) surges after BTIG initiates coverage with a Buy, saying the stock may triple...

    MBIA (MBI +17.4%) surges after BTIG initiates coverage with a Buy, saying the stock may triple if short sellers are forced to cover their positions as the company nears settlements over loan losses during the financial crisis. Large short interest - 28.5M shares short vs. a float of 140.4M shares - plus concentrated institutional ownership "could set the stage for a dramatic short squeeze."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM
  • RCM

    Accretive Health (AH +8.8%) jumps on an Oppenheimer upgrade to Outperform on valuation, noting...

    Accretive Health (AH +8.8%) jumps on an Oppenheimer upgrade to Outperform on valuation, noting the company is well positioned to meet or exceed revenue expectations for 2012.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM
  • SYN

    Shares of microcap biotech developer Adeona Pharmaceuticals (AEN) soar over 23% after reporting...

    Shares of microcap biotech developer Adeona Pharmaceuticals (AEN) soar over 23% after reporting successful results from its pilot Phase I/II safety study of oral high dose zinc therapy in ALS, also known as Lou Gehrig's disease.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM
  • AAL

    While the AMR (AMR +24%) saga is grabbing most of the industry headlines (I, II, III), United...

    While the AMR (AMR +24%) saga is grabbing most of the industry headlines (I, II, III), United Continental (UAL +2.4%) has some news of its own: The company says the FAA has approved its use of a single operating certificate, clearing the way for it to "function as one airline" under the United brand in Q1 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM
  • AAL

    American Airlines (AMR +24.6%) shares hit a circuit breaker and are temporarily halted on the...

    American Airlines (AMR +24.6%) shares hit a circuit breaker and are temporarily halted on the way down after being about 65% higher earlier. They're now fetching $0.32/share after hitting $0.43 this morning.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM
  • MDR

    McDermott International (MDR +10.4%) pops after being initiated with a Buy at Stifel Nicolaus....

    McDermott International (MDR +10.4%) pops after being initiated with a Buy at Stifel Nicolaus. Additionally, the Motley Fool adds that the stock has been battered over recent months, down over 60% from its April highs on on higher costs and large writedowns, and trades at a discount to its peers like Jacobs Engineering (JEC +3.4%) and Fluor (FLR +4.5%).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:04 PM
  • MSFT

    Even LinkedIn (LNKD +9.3%) and other social media stocks are benefiting from today's market...

    Even LinkedIn (LNKD +9.3%) and other social media stocks are benefiting from today's market meltup, but Paul Kedrosky thinks it's only a temporary reprieve, as retail investors sell in droves and institutions aren't adding to their puny 12% post-IPO ownership level; "the stock was broken from the get-go." How many more failed social media IPOs before we learn to avoid the snake oil?

     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM | 1 Comment
  • NFLX

    Adding to Netflix's (NFLX -5.6%) woes today could be a Bernstein note suggesting cable operators...

    Adding to Netflix's (NFLX -5.6%) woes today could be a Bernstein note suggesting cable operators such as CHTR and TWC might respond to the heavy bandwidth usage of Netflix customers by implementing usage-based Internet access billing. Bandwidth expenses only represent a small portion of broadband ISPs' operating costs, but they could prove a good excuse to make life more difficult for a competitor. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM | 1 Comment
  • UNFI

    United Natural Foods (UNFI +8%) jumps after FQ1 earnings beat estimates despite restructuring...

    United Natural Foods (UNFI +8%) jumps after FQ1 earnings beat estimates despite restructuring charges due to the implementation of new warehouse management systems. Margins declined slightly, amid a shift in its customer mix, but the company continues to post double-digit sales growth as it wins new business from competitors.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM
  • BA

    Boeing (BA +4.3%) and its machinists union reach a new four-year labor contract, ensuring the...

    Boeing (BA +4.3%) and its machinists union reach a new four-year labor contract, ensuring the next-generation 737 will be built in Washington state and possibly securing a second 787 assembly line in South Carolina. The general counsel of the NLRB, and likely the Obama administration, will have to sign off on the deal.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM
  • CAT

    Caterpillar (CAT +7%) says it plans to invest $210M in India, consisting of $150 million for a...

    Caterpillar (CAT +7%) says it plans to invest $210M in India, consisting of $150 million for a facility that will produce its Perkins engines, plus an additional $62 million to expand its existing off-highway truck manufacturing facility in Chennai. The investment aims to capitalize on the country's burgeoning road construction and infrastructure development activities.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM | 1 Comment
  • DECK

    Barclays and Jefferies reiterate Buy ratings on Deckers (DECK +2.1%) seeing a preview of the...

    Barclays and Jefferies reiterate Buy ratings on Deckers (DECK +2.1%) seeing a preview of the company's fall 2012 UGG boots lineup. Barclays' checks indicate strong sell-through for UGG products, and is pleased with Deckers' efforts to expand its lineup. Jefferies touts the company's management and store expansion efforts, but warns higher costs could depress near-term profits.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM
  • OA

    Alliant Techsystems (ATK +3.8%) trades higher after being awarded a $20M contract by Orbital...

    Alliant Techsystems (ATK +3.8%) trades higher after being awarded a $20M contract by Orbital Sciences Corporation (ORB +6.5%) to provide its UltraFlex solar arrays to power its enhanced Cygnus cargo logistics space vehicle, which is being utilized by NASA.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM
  • CYTX

    Cytori Therapeutics (CYTX +5%) trades higher after announcing that European regulators have...

    Cytori Therapeutics (CYTX +5%) trades higher after announcing that European regulators have approved its next- generation Celution system, which creates stem and regenerative cells using a patient's own fat cells, for use in hospitals.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM
  • MPC

    Molycorp (MPC +7%) CEO Mark Smith says rare earth prices are at a "pretty comfortable spot for...

    Molycorp (MPC +7%) CEO Mark Smith says rare earth prices are at a "pretty comfortable spot for our customers," noting that while there isn't enough supply to meet the world's demand for the materials used in many high-tech electronics, the industry has learned that customers will stop ordering if prices rise too much. Concerns about the sustainability of prices have weighed on Molycorp shares. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:56 PM
  • TPCG

    TPC Group (TPCG +18.1%) pops after trader chatter circulates that large short positions -...

    TPC Group (TPCG +18.1%) pops after trader chatter circulates that large short positions - including one from State Street - are being unwound this month.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:38 PM
  • RIG

    Shares of Transocean (RIG +2.6%) are stable today after the company prices its 26M share...

    Shares of Transocean (RIG +2.6%) are stable today after the company prices its 26M share secondary offering at $40.50, just a 2.7% discount to Tuesday's close. The drilling giant is using the funds to help refinance its recent acquisition of Norwegian rival Aker Drilling ASA.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:38 PM | 2 Comments
  • CQB

    Chiquita Brands (CQB +6.4%) trades higher after announcing its plans to move its headquarters...

    Chiquita Brands (CQB +6.4%) trades higher after announcing its plans to move its headquarters out of its long-time home in Cincinnati to Charlotte, N.C., as part of its ongoing effort to reduce costs.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:30 PM
  • CAR

    Shares of Zipcar (ZIP -1.6%) lose steam - continuing a downward trend since the firm's IPO -...

    Shares of Zipcar (ZIP -1.6%) lose steam - continuing a downward trend since the firm's IPO - despite launching service in Los Angeles and San Francisco this month (I, II) and catching a favorable rating from Needham. Will car-sharing ever be a viable consumer option if the jobs reports keep improving?

     
     
     
     
    | 1:30 PM
  • GPOR

    Gulfport Energy (GPOR +4.1%) trades higher after pricing its 5M share offering at $29, only a...

    Gulfport Energy (GPOR +4.1%) trades higher after pricing its 5M share offering at $29, only a slight discount to yesterday's close.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM
  • CNH

    Ag and construction equipment company CNH Global (CNH +6.6%) gets a boost after announcing its...

    Ag and construction equipment company CNH Global (CNH +6.6%) gets a boost after announcing its President and CEO Harold Boyanovsky plans to retire at the end of the year, and CFO Richard Tobin will take over both positions.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM
  • EMMS

    Emmis Broadcasting (NASDAQ:EMMS) announces the launch of a modified "Dutch Auction" to purchase...

    Emmis Broadcasting (NASDAQ:EMMS) announces the launch of a modified "Dutch Auction" to purchase up to $6M of its 6.25% series A preferred stock. Shares of EMMS are up 8.3% after the NASDAQ halted trading prior to the media company's announcement.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • CAM

    Cameron International (CAM +7%) moves up on an HSBC upgrade to Overweight. HSBC says the company...

    Cameron International (CAM +7%) moves up on an HSBC upgrade to Overweight. HSBC says the company has been firmly on track to post solid FY11 results, thanks to its exposure to recovering onshore and offshore equipment markets, and is well placed to benefit from strong growth in subsea drilling throughout FY12 as well.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • ZAGG

    Shares of Zagg (ZAGG +8.6%) soar after the firm announces its website traffic during Black...

    Shares of Zagg (ZAGG +8.6%) soar after the firm announces its website traffic during Black Friday and Cyber Monday hit record levels. The firm says 585K online shoppers visited Zagg.com on Cyber Monday as it rocked a 94% Y/Y increase in cybersales.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • AFOP

    Alliance Fiber Optic Products (AFOP -8.3%) dips after cutting its Q4 revenue guidance due to a...

    Alliance Fiber Optic Products (AFOP -8.3%) dips after cutting its Q4 revenue guidance due to a reduction in order rates and the worse-than-anticipated impact on its markets due to the Thailand flooding.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM
  • SDRL

    Norwegian oil services company Seadrill (SDRL +6.2%) moves up after its Q3 results beat...

    Norwegian oil services company Seadrill (SDRL +6.2%) moves up after its Q3 results beat estimates, despite a 90% Y/Y drop in profit due to a $330M derivatives loss. Its jack-up rigs business posted strong operating earnings as major oil companies increased their offshore exploration activity to capitalize on high oil prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM
  • SFLY

    Shutterfly (SFLY -9.4%) takes a hit on fallout from yesterday's presentation at Baird's...

    Shutterfly (SFLY -9.4%) takes a hit on fallout from yesterday's presentation at Baird's technology conference, where the company said it's seeing a significant amount of competitor discounting, which may limit upside for the company. In addition, Shutterfly's management added that it doesn't have any creation app for Apple devices.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM
  • GS

    Goldman Sachs (GS +5%) shares see a spike in volume as Bloomberg TV reports CEO Lloyd Blankfein...

    Goldman Sachs (GS +5%) shares see a spike in volume as Bloomberg TV reports CEO Lloyd Blankfein may be deposed in the Rajat Gupta insider trading case. Gupta allegedly passed tips to Raj Rajaratnam, the convicted hedge fund manager in one of the biggest insider trading schemes in history.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM
  • CRIS

    Biotech developer Curis (CRIS +5%) gets a lift after saying it's entered into an agreement with...

    Biotech developer Curis (CRIS +5%) gets a lift after saying it's entered into an agreement with The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society to support the ongoing development of its oral small molecule dual Pi3K and HDAC inhibitor CUDC-907, a treatment for patients with B-cell lymphoma and multiple myeloma.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM
  • AAL

    AMR's 50% surge today is odd given the stock soon will be worthless, analysts say. The only case...

    AMR's 50% surge today is odd given the stock soon will be worthless, analysts say. The only case of an airline using old stock when coming out of bankruptcy appears to be Hawaiian Holdings (NASDAQ:HA), but Hawaiian was profitable and had equity; AMR hasn't turned a profit in years and has a "huge negative net worth." Even if USAirways (LCC) buys AMR, as is speculated, AMR likely would first issue new stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • CAST

    ChinaCast Education (OTCPK:CAST +3.1%) announces it will delay its annual meeting of...

    ChinaCast Education (OTCPK:CAST +3.1%) announces it will delay its annual meeting of stockholders scheduled for Friday to Dec. 16. Shares of CAST have recovered some ground lost after the publication of a critical analysis of the post-secondary and online education firm's SEC financial statements, but remain down for the week.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM | 3 Comments
  • CSCO

    Cisco (CSCO +5.6%) surges after Deutsche Bank recommends the world’s biggest maker of...

    Cisco (CSCO +5.6%) surges after Deutsche Bank recommends the world’s biggest maker of networking equipment, saying checks suggest demand for data center IT rollouts in areas such as 10-gigabit ethernet switches, application virtualization and security are "robust." Cisco may be gaining on competitors such Juniper (JNPR +6.5%) thanks to IT’s increase in "architecture" of networks.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • DAN

    Dana Holding (DAN +5.5%) pops after being initiated with a Sector Perform at RBC Capital with a...

    Dana Holding (DAN +5.5%) pops after being initiated with a Sector Perform at RBC Capital with a price target of $16.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • ANRZQ

    Commodities enjoy a banner day: copper +7.1% to new highs at $3.62, Nymex crude +1.3% to...

    Commodities enjoy a banner day: copper +7.1% to new highs at $3.62, Nymex crude +1.3% to $101.06, gold +1.9% to $1,751.70. Among stocks: Alpha Natural Resources (ANR +12.7%), Alcoa (AA +5.5%), Freeport McMoran (FCX +6.4%) U.S. Steel (X +11.9%), AK Steel (AKS +9.1%), Allegheny Technologies (ATI +9.3%).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • DRH

    Homebuilders are rallying hard following the release of strong pending home sales data. DRH...

    Homebuilders are rallying hard following the release of strong pending home sales data. DRH +6.1%. KBH +8.8%. MHO +14.4%. LEN +6.8%. TOL +5%. HOV +9.5%. MTH +7.2%. RYL +6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM | 1 Comment
  • LEA

    Shares of Lear (LEA +4.5%) get a boost from an RBC initiation with a Sector Perform and a $52...

    Shares of Lear (LEA +4.5%) get a boost from an RBC initiation with a Sector Perform and a $52 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM
  • OVTI

    Needham maintains its Hold rating on OmniVision (OVTI -7%) after its outlook warning, even as it...

    Needham maintains its Hold rating on OmniVision (OVTI -7%) after its outlook warning, even as it expects "further degradation in demand entering the January quarter." OVTI suffered "unexpected order cutbacks across several of its major handset customers and saw its notebook business decline due to lower demand and the impact from the Thailand flooding."
     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM
  • CECO

    Pay for performance?: Embattled Career Education (CECO +2.4%) files an amended 8-K with the SEC...

    Pay for performance?: Embattled Career Education (CECO +2.4%) files an amended 8-K with the SEC that indicates ex-CEO Gary McCullough will pick up a tidy $5.3M in salary and bonuses on top of a generous package of insurance benefits. Meanwhile, the company faces a myriad of lawsuits and investigations over its school accreditations - while shares are off a mere 66% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM | 2 Comments
  • ADSK

    CAD software giant Autodesk (ADSK +7.1%) shoots higher after announcing the acquisition of...

    CAD software giant Autodesk (ADSK +7.1%) shoots higher after announcing the acquisition of Horizontal Systems, a developer of cloud-based building modeling software. Canaccord thinks Autodesk's entry into the cloud software space will both increase its addressable market, and improve the predictability of its results (given cloud software sales tend to be subscription-based).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM
  • WDC

    SanDisk (SNDK +5.9%) shares surge after Morgan Stanley speculates the stock will rise vs. the...

    SanDisk (SNDK +5.9%) shares surge after Morgan Stanley speculates the stock will rise vs. the chip industry over the next 60 days, as the stock's recent slide makes short-term valuation compelling. The pullback "is fully discounting the NAND year-end pricing seasonality," while industry checks "indicate NAND demand outlook has improved."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • SYT

    Syngenta (SYT +3.5%) trades up after Jefferies initiates the stock with a Buy. Jefferies notes...

    Syngenta (SYT +3.5%) trades up after Jefferies initiates the stock with a Buy. Jefferies notes that the company is "a global leader in agricultural chemicals with a growing seeds platform and a solid pipeline, poised to grow EPS at a 10% rate, or better."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • T

    Leap Wireless (LEAP +12.7%) powers higher after RBC Capital raises its rating on the shares to...

    Leap Wireless (LEAP +12.7%) powers higher after RBC Capital raises its rating on the shares to Outperform from Sector Perform and ups its price target to $11 from $9. RBC particularly likes the new MUVE music service, which "creates customer stickiness because content is downloaded to the phone rather than streamed. This translates to a better user experience in areas of weaker data coverage."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • HSH

    Sara Lee (SLE +3.2%) and its Norwegian partner Kaffehuset Friele sign an agreement with ISS A/S...

    Sara Lee (SLE +3.2%) and its Norwegian partner Kaffehuset Friele sign an agreement with ISS A/S to acquire its House of Coffee business, a leading foodservice provider specializing in beverage solutions to offices and institutions in Norway and Denmark.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP +7.2%) joins other rare earth miners in rallying (REMX +6.1%) after Morgan Stanley...

    Molycorp (MCP +7.2%) joins other rare earth miners in rallying (REMX +6.1%) after Morgan Stanley reiterates an Overweight and $90 PT. The firm thinks investors lack confidence in Molycorp's ability to execute, especially following its weak Q4 guidance, and thinks shares could rally as sales volumes are locked in. (magnet JV)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • UAL

    Shares of United Continental (UAL -1%) and Delta Air Lines (DAL -0.8%) get nipped by a planned...

    Shares of United Continental (UAL -1%) and Delta Air Lines (DAL -0.8%) get nipped by a planned strike in the U.K. from immigration workers. The labor dispute is expected to create severe delays and cancellations at both of London's main airports.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM
  • KELYA

    Following a familiar pattern, staffing company stocks ratchet higher following a positive jobs...

    Following a familiar pattern, staffing company stocks ratchet higher following a positive jobs report. Part-time hiring by companies is viewed by analysts as a likely scenario for many companies who want to stay flexible in the face of economic uncertainty. Gainers: KELYA +5.4%, MAN +7.5%, KFRC +7.2%, RHI +5.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • JOSB

    Shares of Jos. A. Bank Clothiers (JOSB -3.8%) lose ground after the firm warns in its Q3 report...

    Shares of Jos. A. Bank Clothiers (JOSB -3.8%) lose ground after the firm warns in its Q3 report that Q4 sales are starting off somewhat sluggish. "November comparable store sales declined, while our direct segment sales increased, compared to the same period last year."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM
  • AATI

    Wireless chipmakers Advanced Analogic (AATI +32.5%) and Skyworks (SWKS +10.3%) surge after...

    Wireless chipmakers Advanced Analogic (AATI +32.5%) and Skyworks (SWKS +10.3%) surge after announcing a revised merger agreement in which the latter will acquire the former for $5.80/share in cash. Though the price is below the $6.13/share agreed to in May, investors had feared the deal would collapse entirely after Skyworks filed notices of breach (I, II) against Advanced Analogic.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM

  • Commodities and their ETFs are romping, boosted by China's move towards easing and news more...

    Commodities and their ETFs are romping, boosted by China's move towards easing and news more dollars are soon to be sloshing around the world. GLD +1.6% (the metal itself is up 2.1%), WTI crude USO +1.7%, Copper JJC +4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM
  • PCXCQ

    Coal stocks are soaring on word that the world's central banks are playing together nicely....

    Coal stocks are soaring on word that the world's central banks are playing together nicely. Double-digit gainers include PCX +14.2%, JRCC +13.5%, ANR +12%, and CNX +10% - while the Market Vectors Coal ETF (NYSEARCA:KOL) checks in at +7.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX -3.1%) sees more selling pressure following a downgrade to Underperform from...
